name: AttachObjectToObject
notes:
Both objects need to be created before attempting to attach them.
 There is no player-object version of this function (AttachPlayerObjectToObject), meaning it will not be supported by streamers.
versions: This function was added in SA-MP 0.3d and will not work in earlier versions!
description: You can use this function to attach objects to other objects. The objects will folow the main object.
params_title: (objectid, attachtoid, Float:OffsetX, Float:OffsetY, Float:OffsetZ, Float:RotX, Float:RotY, Float:RotZ, SyncRotation = 1)

params_body.name: objectid
params_body.description: The object to attach to another object.

params_body.name: attachtoid
params_body.description: The object to attach the object to.

params_body.name: Float:OffsetX
params_body.description: The distance between the main object and the object in the X direction.

params_body.name: Float:OffsetY
params_body.description: The distance between the main object and the object in the Y direction.

params_body.name: Float:OffsetZ
params_body.description: The distance between the main object and the object in the Z direction.

params_body.name: Float:RotX
params_body.description: The X rotation between the object and the main object.

params_body.name: Float:RotY
params_body.description: The Y rotation between the object and the main object.

params_body.name: Float:RotZ
params_body.description: The Z rotation between the object and the main object.

params_body.name: SyncRotation
params_body.description: If set to 0, objectid's rotation will not change with attachtoid's.

return_values: 0: The function failed to execute. This means the first object (objectid) does not exist. There are no internal checks to verify that the second object (attachtoid) exists.
